business.headline: Income tax return filing deadline extended from July 31 to September 15This extension mostly helps salaried employees and other individuals whose accounts don't need to be audited. These taxpayers generally have a July 31 deadline each year.
Sensex closes 624 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; IndusInd Bank ends 3% upSensex closes 624 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; IndusInd Bank ends 3% up

Retired before March 2025? Don't miss UPS benefits for you or your spouseIntroduced by the Central Government on April 1, 2025, the UPS provides additional benefits to those who have completed at least 10 years of qualifying service in the Central Government and their legally wedded spouses.

Pakistan's bailout addiction: Why the IMF keeps saving a sinking economyWhy does Pakistan keep turning to the IMF for rescue, but never seems to recover? What's trapping its economy in this endless bailout loop? Dive in to find out.

'GDP means little if it hides empty plates': Analyst on India's inequality crisisIndia's economy may be booming, but over half its people still can't afford three meals a day, notes an analyst. In contrast, smaller African economies like Nigeria, Kenya, and Ghana rank higher in tackling hunger.

Borana Weaves lists at 13% premium: Should you hold or book profit?Borana Weaves' listing was slightly below what many in the market had expected. The grey market premium (GMP) had been showing a possible listing gain of 20-22%, with the premium standing at Rs 43-45 before the listing.

'Could take 50 years': Gurugram startup founder on India matching Japan's lifeIndia's economic journey faces significant hurdles as inequality, agricultural dependency, and regional disparities hinder progress towards matching Japan's quality of life.

Volvo to slash 3,000 white-collar jobs in restructuring move: ReportA major portion of the cost-cutting will come from trimming white-collar roles, which account for around 40% of the company's total staff. Globally, the company has about 29,000 employees in Europe, 10,000 in Asia, and 3,000 in the Americas.

Borana Weaves share price: Stock extends gains after listing at 13% premiumWhile the listing price was above the issue price, it was slightly lower than what many expected. In the grey market, the stock had shown a premium of Rs 43-45 ahead of the listing, which suggested possible gains of around 20-22% on debut.

Good news for exporters as key tax refund scheme to return. Details hereThe Remission of Duties and Taxes on Exported Products (RoDTEP) scheme, which reimburses levies not covered by any other government programme, had been on hold since February 5 but will now resume.

IndiGo co-founder sells $1.36 billion of airline's shares: ReportThe shares were sold at 5,230.5 rupees ($61.35) each, the term sheet seen by Reuters showed, representing a discount of 3.5% to the company's closing price on Monday.

Explained: Why Sagility India Ltd shares fell 5% todaySagility India Ltd said it remains confident of steady performance through the next financial year. It expects growth supported by a strong balance sheet, a wide client base, and consistent business execution.

entertainment.headline: HBO reveals new Harry Potter cast: Meet the fresh faces of the Wizarding WorldHBO has announced the new cast for its Harry Potter series, with Dominic McLaughlin, Arabella Stanton, and Alastair Stout as the lead trio. Production begins this summer with a star-studded supporting cast.

TV actor Dipika Kakar diagnosed with stage 2 cancer: I will sail through thisTV actor Dipika Kakar has been diagnosed with stage 2 cancer. She remains hopeful and asks fans for prayers as she begins treatment.

Jennifer Lopez dazzles, Heidi Klum disappoints: AMAs 2025 style recapFrom Jennifer Lopez's daring gown to Shaboozey's chaotic layers, the 2025 AMAs were a fashion rollercoaster. Ciara and Wayne Brady dazzled, while Heidi Klum and Montag missed the style mark.

Tom Cruise posts gratitude note after Mission Impossible 8's terrific weekendActor Tom Cruise shared a heartfelt note after the success of 'Mission Impossible: The Final Reckoning' expressing his gratitude to the fans and crew members.
Pankaj Tripathi attends nephew's wedding in Bihar. See pics, videoActor Pankaj Tripathi recently attended his nephew's wedding in Siwan, Bihar. He was also seen posing with the newlyweds.

Viral: When The Phone Rings actor Chae Soo-bin shoots in MumbaiChae Soo-bin of 'When The Phone Rings' fame, was seen filming in Mumbai's rainy streets for Crocs. Her surprise visit has created a buzz among Indian K-drama enthusiasts.

Housefull 5 trailer X reactions: Fans call Akshay Kumar 'comedy ka asli king'Social media users heaped praise on Akshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5' trailer on social media. Fans hailed Akshay Kumar's comic timing ahead of the film's release.

Kanappa team slams 'cowardly attempts' to leak 90 minutes of stolen footageThe 'Kanappa' team has issued an official statement about the stolen hard-drive of their upcoming period action-drama. 24 Frames Factory has alleged that the perpetrators are planning to leak 90-minute footage.

Amid Vanga-Deepika row, Triptii Dimri bags biggest pay cheque of her careerActor Triptii Dimri has secured her biggest fee of Rs 6 crore for the upcoming film 'Spirit'. The project, directed by Sandeep Reddy Vanga, features 'Baahubali' star Prabhas in the lead role.

Ajay Devgn, Jackie Chan on action, crossover ahead of Karate Kid: Legends releaseActors Ajay Devgn and Jackie Chan discussed their possible collaboration ahead of 'Karate Kid: Legends' release. The film marks Ajay and Yug Devgan's debut in their voiceovers for the Hindi version of the film.

Rajinikanth gets staggering Rs 150 crore salary for Rs 350 crore-Coolie: ReportDirector Lokesh Kanagaraj's 'Coolie' is reportedly made on a Rs 350-crore budget with Rajinikanth earning a record salary. The film is gearing up for an August release.

Actor Simbu on working with Kamal Haasan: I kept getting lost in his masteryActor Silambarasan aka Simbu expressed admiration for Kamal Haasan's mastery over his craft while filming Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life'. He also discussed his personal spiritual growth and how it shapes his outlook on life.

Billie Eilish sweeps 2025 AMAs, BTS' RM wins Best K-pop Artist. Full winners listSinger Billie Eilish dominated the 2025 American Music Awards, taking home multiple top honours, including Artist of the Year. Meanwhile, BTS's RM made waves by winning Best K-Pop Artist, marking a major solo milestone. The night celebrated a diverse mix of global talent across genres.

Akshay doesn't 'appreciate' anyone calling Paresh 'foolish' for leaving Hera Pheri 3Akshay Kumar reacted to the media's question about Paresh Rawal being called 'foolish' for leaving 'Hera Pheri 3'. The actor defended his co-star and refrained from commenting on the issue, which is subjudice.

Alia Bhatt attends friend's wedding in Spain, stuns in boho-chic lookBollywood actor Alia Bhatt attended her friend's wedding in Spain. The actor wore a vibrant multi-coloured lehenga paired with a bandanna and sunglasses.

Housefull 5 trailer: Akshay Kumar's film is mad-house of laughter, glamour, mysteryThe trailer of 'Housefull 5' is full of funny one-liners and self-deprecating humour. The film is led by Akshay Kumar, Abhishek Bachchan and Riteish Deshmukh with other popular and interesting faces adding more mystery to the whodunit.

Deepika's rumoured exit from Spirit, Vanga's 'billi' jibe - who's really in khundak?Actor Deepika Padukone reportedly exited Sandeep Reddy Vanga's 'Spirit', leaving the director furious. So much so that he wrote a long note on social media without naming the actor but referring to her as 'billi in khundak', meaning 'an angry cat'.

I like AI, but not sure if AI will like me : Kamal Haasan | ExclusiveIn an exclusive interview with Kamal Haasan, actor Kamal Haasan opened up about artificial intelligence's role in cinema ahead of his new film 'Thug Life'. The movie marks a historic reunion with director Mani Ratnam after nearly four decades.

Dubai woman detained for trespassing on actor Aditya Roy Kapur's houseA woman was detained for trespassing at Aditya Roy Kapur's residence while he was away. This was not her first such incident. Last week, she reportedly attempted to gain access to superstar Salman Khan's residence.

general news.headline: US pauses new student visa interviews in social media vetting push: ReportThe move could seriously disrupt student visa processing and financially strain US universities that depend heavily on international enrolments.

Actor Kamal Haasan says Kannada was born out of Tamil, faces backlashActor Kamal Haasan made a remark that Kannada language originated from Tamil at a film event in Chennai. The remark has triggered protests in Karnataka, with pro-Kannada groups demanding an apology.

Starship crashes over Indian Ocean as SpaceX loses control mid-flightThe Starship upper stage was carrying eight Starlink simulator satellites, intended to be deployed in orbit as part of SpaceX's ongoing efforts to validate the vehicle.

Trump claims Canada may join US as 51st state for Golden Dome defence dealPresident Trump claims Canada is considering becoming the 51st US state in exchange for free access to his $175 billion Golden Dome missile defense system. Ottawa has not officially responded.

Patel differed with Nehru on Kashmir, says PM Modi. Here are the factsPrime Minister Narendra Modi recently said the Congress government under Jawaharlal Nehru did not heed the advice of then-Home Minister Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel on the Kashmir issue in 1947. What was Patel's stand on military action to reclaim Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (POK) and taking the issue to the UN? Here's a look at how Patel and Nehru diverged on Kashmir.

Operation Sindoor: Indian Army reveals designers behind viral logoTwo Indian Army personnel designed Operation Sindoor's symbolic logo, which has become a viral emblem of justice following precision strikes in response to the Pahalgam massacre. The logo reflects India's resolve against terror.

RCB book Qualifier 1 spot after Jitesh Sharma special trumps Rishabh Pant tonIPL 2025, LSG vs RCB: Stand-in captain Jitesh Sharma produced a knock for the ages, hitting 85 in just 33 balls to help RCB script their highest successful chase of 228 in Lucknow. RCB ended their 9-year wait to finish in the top two of the points table and booked their place in Qualifier 1.

We're going to be looking at you: US warns of tougher student visa checksThe US State Department has signalled tougher visa screenings, including potential social media checks, for international students, affirming, "We're going to be looking at you," amid heightened security concerns.

Watch: Jitesh Sharma hugs Rishabh Pant after LSG captain withdraws run out appealLucknow Super Giants captain Rishabh Pant chose to withdraw a run-out appeal against Royal Challengers Bengaluru's stand-in skipper Jitesh Sharma in a powerful act of sportsmanship.

Amazon Fashion's 'SERVE' Store Offers Convenience, Selection and Value to Gen Z, says Nikhil Sinha, Director, Amazon FashionIndia's first dedicated Gen Z fashion store democratizes style access across the country with 3X customer growth

Punjab boy who served milk, lassi to jawans during Op Sindoor honoured by ArmyThe Indian Army honoured a 10-year-old boy from Punjab's Ferozepur district for his unwavering committment during the India-Pakistan conflict. He helped the soldiers by bringing water, milk and other items as they fought the battle in the scorching heat.

Pakistan player's 'arrogant' handshake with Indian tennis star shocks fansIndia defeated Pakistan 2-0 in the Junior Davis Cup U16 tournament in Kazakhstan. The match sparked controversy after an unsportsmanlike handshake from one of Pakistan's players.

TV actor Dipika Kakar diagnosed with stage 2 cancer: I will sail through thisTV actor Dipika Kakar has been diagnosed with stage 2 cancer. She remains hopeful and asks fans for prayers as she begins treatment.

Ghulam Nabi Azad, part of Op Sindoor delegation, hospitalised mid-tourFormer Union Minister Ghulam Nabi Azad, who is a part of the outreach delegation on Operation Sindoor, has been admitted to hospital during his tour to Saudi Arabia.

India closer to 5th-gen fighter jet as Rs 15,000-crore plan cleared: What it meansIndia's ambitious AMCA project aims to develop a medium-weight, deep-penetration fighter jet with advanced stealth capabilities to significantly enhance the country's air power.

Covid comeback? US detects new variant linked to China's latest surgeA fast-spreading Covid-19 variant from China, NB.1.8.1, has reached the US. Though less deadly, experts warn it's more contagious and may evade vaccine protection.

You're playing with fire: Trump rebukes Putin as Ukraine war escalatesUS President Donald Trump warned his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin is "playing with fire" amid Russia's latest military gains in Ukraine, criticising the Kremlin's refusal to commit to a ceasefire and calling Putin "absolutely crazy."

Mails from Indians on immigration akin to spam: New Zealand minister sparks rowNew Zealand Immigration Minister Erica Stanford sparked a row after stating that she "almost regards as spam" the numerous unsolicited emails from Indians seeking immigration advice. Indian-origin Labour MP Priyanca Radhakrishnan, slammed Stanford for "unfairly singling out an ethnic group".

30 stuck mid-air for over three hours after joyride malfunctions in ChennaiA joyride malfunction in a private amusement park in Chennai left 30 people, including women and children, stuck at a height of above 50 feet.

Indore couple goes missing in Meghalaya, abandoned scooter found on hillsideA honeymooning couple from Indore has gone missing near Sohra in Meghalaya, marking the second case of tourist disappearance in East Khasi Hills in two months.
India wants Pak back on anti-terror watchdog grey list, to present dossierIndia has gathered evidence showing how Pakistan is funding terrorist activities and misusing international financial aid.

Melania Trump shuts down son Barron's Harvard rumour: He never appliedMelania Trump denied rumours that her son Barron Trump was rejected by Harvard amid Trump's escalating feud with the university. The 19-year-old is currently attending NYU and is not involved in the Harvard drama.

Will Nara Lokesh be crowned TDP's king-in-waiting at Mahanadu?As the TDP's three-day Mahanadu event started on Tuesday, all eyes were on Nara Lokesh, son of party chief and CM N Chandrababu Naidu. With Lokesh credited for the party's 2024 poll success, reports suggest that he may soon be officially named TDP's working president, the No. 2 in the party.

Class 11 student raped by father's friend in Bhopal, accused on the runA case was filed against a man accused of raping and impregnating a 17-year-old girl in Bhopal. The girl, who is a student of Class 11, told the police that the accused was her father's acquaintance and had known her.

sports.headline: RCB's stunning record, Kohli's 9k: All stats from IPL 2025's last league gameRoyal Challengers Bengaluru stunned Lucknow Super Giants by chasing 228 runs in 18.4 overs at Ekana Stadium. This historic win secured RCB's second place and a Qualifier 1 spot.

Barcelona starboy Lamine Yamal extends contract till 2031Barcelona's teenage star Lamine Yamal has signed a contract extension until 2031. This deal rewards his outstanding 2024–25 season and sets the stage for future success at the club.

Jitesh is here: Old interview goes viral as RCB storm into Qualifier 1Jitesh Sharma played a sensational unbeaten innings of 85 off 33 balls to guide RCB to a must-win victory over Lucknow Super Giants. After the match, one of his old interviews went viral on social media.

Jitesh Sharma credits 'guru Dinesh Karthik anna' after heroic finish vs LSGAfter playing a match-winning 85-run knock against LSG, stand-in skipper Jitesh Sharma credited RCB batting coach Dinesh Karthik's mentorship for shaping his mindset under pressure.

Watch: Jitesh Sharma hugs Rishabh Pant after LSG captain withdraws run out appealLucknow Super Giants captain Rishabh Pant chose to withdraw a run-out appeal against Royal Challengers Bengaluru's stand-in skipper Jitesh Sharma in a powerful act of sportsmanship.

IPL 2025 playoffs decided: RCB, PBKS, MI and GT learn fateRoyal Challengers Bengaluru chased down a record 228 runs at Ekana Stadium to secure a spot in IPL playoffs. The win boosts RCB's momentum ahead of Qualifier 1 where they face a high-flying Punjab Kings.

RCB book Qualifier 1 spot after Jitesh Sharma special trumps Rishabh Pant tonIPL 2025, LSG vs RCB: Stand-in captain Jitesh Sharma produced a knock for the ages, hitting 85 in just 33 balls to help RCB script their highest successful chase of 228 in Lucknow. RCB ended their 9-year wait to finish in the top two of the points table and booked their place in Qualifier 1.

Pantastic: LSG owner's one-word praise for Rishabh Pant after 118 goes viralIPL 2025, LSG vs RCB: Rishabh Pant scored his maiden IPL hundred for Lucknow Super Giants on Tuesday. Owner Sanjiv Goenka congratulated the skipper with a one-word social media post.

Virat Kohli overtakes David Warner for most fifties in IPL historyVirat Kohli smashed his 62nd IPL fifty while batting against Lucknow Super Giants on May 27. Kohli's innings meant that he overtook David Warner for most fifties in the history of the tournament.

T Dilip reappointed as India fielding coach for England tourA month after being removed as part of a support staff overhaul, T. Dilip has been reinstated by the Indian cricket board (BCCI) as the fielding coach for India's upcoming five-Test tour of England, set to begin next month.

RCB's Virat Kohli first batter to complete 9000 T20 runs for one franchiseRoyal Challengers Bengaluru's star batter Virat Kohli reached the milestone of 9,000 runs for the franchise during their IPL 2025 match against Lucknow Super Giants at the Ekana Cricket Stadium on Tuesday.

RCB book Qualifier 1 spot after Jitesh Sharma special trumps Rishabh Pant tonIPL 2025, LSG vs RCB: Stand-in captain Jitesh Sharma produced a knock for the ages, hitting 85 in just 33 balls to help RCB script their highest successful chase of 228 in Lucknow. RCB ended their 9-year wait to finish in the top two of the points table and booked their place in Qualifier 1.

Pantastic: LSG owner's one-word praise for Rishabh Pant after 118 goes viralIPL 2025, LSG vs RCB: Rishabh Pant scored his maiden IPL hundred for Lucknow Super Giants on Tuesday. Owner Sanjiv Goenka congratulated the skipper with a one-word social media post.

Virat Kohli overtakes David Warner for most fifties in IPL historyVirat Kohli smashed his 62nd IPL fifty while batting against Lucknow Super Giants on May 27. Kohli's innings meant that he overtook David Warner for most fifties in the history of the tournament.

T Dilip reappointed as India fielding coach for England tourA month after being removed as part of a support staff overhaul, T. Dilip has been reinstated by the Indian cricket board (BCCI) as the fielding coach for India's upcoming five-Test tour of England, set to begin next month.

RCB's Virat Kohli first batter to complete 9000 T20 runs for one franchiseRoyal Challengers Bengaluru's star batter Virat Kohli reached the milestone of 9,000 runs for the franchise during their IPL 2025 match against Lucknow Super Giants at the Ekana Cricket Stadium on Tuesday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
